abstract: General Motors is aiming for mid-August to file for an initial public offering and is seeking a $5 billion credit line financed by several banks, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
snippet: General Motors is aiming for mid-August to file for an initial public offering and is seeking a $5 billion credit line financed by several banks, people briefed on the matter told DealBook.
lead_paragraph: 6:08 p.m. | Updated General Motors is aiming for mid-August to file for an initial public offering, in what would be its biggest step yet toward paying back its bailout by the federal government, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Friday.

headline.main: G.M. Aims for Mid-August I.P.O. Filing

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
